Kernel/sources/terminal/kterminal.c

00001 //Kernel Terminal
00002 #include <terminal/terminal.h>
00003 #include <stdio.h>
00004 terminal_t* g_kernelTerminal = 0;
00005 terminal_t* g_terminalInContext = 0;
00006 
00007 terminal_t* getTerminalInContext()
00008 {
00009         return g_terminalInContext;
00010 }
00011 
00012 void kernel_terminal_putc(terminal_t* term, char c)
00013 {
00014         if (term == g_terminalInContext)
00015                 text_mode_tputc(term, c);
00016         else
00017         {
00018                 //Write to the backup data which stores a copy of the terminal when its not in context
00019                 text_mode_putc_prec(term->m_backupData, term->m_backgroundColour, term->m_foregroundColour, &term->m_cursorX, &term->m_cursorY, c);
00020         }
00021 }
00022 
00023 void kernel_terminal_setfg(terminal_t* term, uint8 col)
00024 {
00025         term->m_foregroundColour = col;
00026 
00027         if (term == g_terminalInContext)
00028                 text_mode_tsetfg(term, col);
00029 }
00030 
00031 void kernel_terminal_setbg(terminal_t* term, uint8 col)
00032 {
00033         term->m_backgroundColour = col;
00034 
00035         if (term == g_terminalInContext)
00036                 text_mode_tsetbg(term, col);
00037 }
00038 
00039 void kernel_terminal_clear(terminal_t* term)
00040 {
00041         if (term == g_terminalInContext)
00042                 text_mode_tclear(term);
00043         else
00044         {
00045                 //Clear the screen using the direct video memory access on the backup data
00046                 text_mode_clearscreen_prec(term->m_backupData, term->m_backgroundColour, &term->m_cursorX, &term->m_cursorY); 
00047         }
00048 }
00049 
00050 void kernel_terminal_update_cursor(terminal_t* term)
00051 {
00052         if (term == g_terminalInContext)
00053                 text_mode_tup(term);
00054         else
00055         {
00056                 //Don't need to do anything. Not in context
00057         }
00058 }
00059 
00060 void kputc(char c);
00061 
00062 void initializeKernelTerminal()
00063 {
00064         //Make a new terminal and set the screens terminal to this new terminal
00065         g_kernelTerminal = makeNewTerminal(80, 25);
00066 
00067         setDefaultTerminalCallbacks(g_kernelTerminal);
00068         setTerminalContext(g_kernelTerminal);
00069 }
00070 
00071 void setDefaultTerminalCallbacks(terminal_t* term)
00072 {
00073         term->f_updateCursor = &kernel_terminal_update_cursor;
00074         term->f_putchar = &kernel_terminal_putc;
00075 
00076         term->f_setForeground = &kernel_terminal_setfg;
00077         term->f_setBackground = &kernel_terminal_setbg;
00078 
00079         term->f_clear = &kernel_terminal_clear;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void setTerminalContext(terminal_t* term)
00083 {
00084         g_terminalInContext = term;
00085         text_mode_sett(term);
00086 }
00087 
00088 //Clear the kernel terminals screen
00089 void kcls()
00090 {
00091         if (!g_kernelTerminal) return;
00092         if (!g_kernelTerminal->m_used) return;
00093 
00094         g_kernelTerminal->f_clear(g_kernelTerminal);    
00095 }
00096 
00097 //Put a character on the kernel terminals screen
00098 void kputc(char c)
00099 {
00100         if (g_kernelTerminal == 0) {
00101                 text_mode_putc(c);
00102         }
00103         else
00104         {
00105                 g_kernelTerminal->f_putchar(g_kernelTerminal, c);
00106         }
00107 }
00108 
00109 //Move the X cursor on the kernel terminal
00110 void kmovecx(unsigned int x)
00111 {
00112         g_kernelTerminal->m_cursorX = x;
00113         g_kernelTerminal->f_updateCursor(g_kernelTerminal);
00114 }
00115 
00116 //Move the Y cursor on the kernel terminal
00117 void kmovecy(unsigned int y)
00118 {
00119         g_kernelTerminal->m_cursorY = y;
00120         g_kernelTerminal->f_updateCursor(g_kernelTerminal);
00121 }
00122 
00123 //Get the x cursor on the kernel terminal
00124 unsigned int kgetcx()
00125 {
00126         return g_kernelTerminal->m_cursorX;
00127 }
00128 
00129 //Get the y cursor on the kernel terminal
00130 unsigned int kgetcy()
00131 {
00132         return g_kernelTerminal->m_cursorY;
00133 }
00134 
00135 //Put a string to the kernel terminal
00136 void kputs(const char* s)
00137 {
00138         for (; *s != 0; s++)
00139                 kputc(*s);
00140 }
